page.title: 08TRAFFIC IN THORPE-LE-SOKEN.
page.content: WHEN MRS. WRIGHT, THE CHAIRMAN OF THE PARISH COUNCIL, CAME TO TALK TO CLASS 5 SHE TOLD US THAT THE BIGGEST CHANGE SHE HAD SEEN DURING THE 59 YEARS SHE HAD LIVED IN THORPE-LE-SOKEN WAS THE AMOUNT OF TRAFFIC COMING THROUGH THE VILLAGE. ON WEDNESDAY I COUNTED THE TRAFFIC THAT WENT PAST MY HOUSE IN THE HIGH STREET FOR 15 MINUTES FROM 8.30a.m. THERE WERE 111 CARS, 12 LORRIES, 14 VANS, 3 COACHES, 1 BUS, 1 TRACTOR, 2 MOTORBIKES AND 3 BICYCLES, A TOTAL OF 147 VEHICLES! PLANS HAVE BEEN PASSED FOR INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT NEAR THE RAILWAY STATION WHICH WILL MEAN EVEN MORE TRAFFIC, ESPECIALLY LORRIES, PASSING THROUGH OUR VILLAGE. THE ENORMOUS TRANSPORTERS WHICH CARRY UP TO 8 CARS MAKE THE PAVEMENTS SHAKE. NO WONDER MRS. WRIGHT SAID THE CHANGE SHE WOULD MOST LIKE TO SEE IS A BYPASS FOR THORPE-LE-SOKEN.
